review: With some minor glitch sometimes, this little device is perfect for playing movie through youtube or Netflix. Cannot be wrong with this affordable price.
author: mark M

review: Pros:- Youtube streaming works pretty well with my iPad mini.  I can send Youtube videos from my device to TV very easily.  The picture quality is not great, but it's not bad either.Cons:- Don't count on being able to stream your computer's screen to your TV from Chrome.  The Chrome extension can be very buggy.  It barely functions on one of my computers and on the other one, it's totally unusable.  I looked online and lots of other buyers are having problems too.  Even when it works, there's a lot of lag even though my internet connection is fairly fast.- An Apple TV would've been a much better since I use Apple devices.  I thought this would be almost as good, but it's really not.
author: Brian Flaherty

review: This is a great product if you understand what its' purpose is. I mainly use it to stream Youtube videos from my phone or iPad. I also occasionally use it to play music. I must say, the streaming quality on it is fantastic. I have had no issues with it. It is incredibly detailed and smooth.
author: Neil

review: I bought this for $5 off the normal price on Amazon Prime.  Setup was super easy. Streamed Netflix, HBO Go, Youtube, and Play Movies, all without issue.This really is a cool little device and it is not very expensive. It was cheap enough so that if it did not work out, I would send it back. But it is definitely a keeper. What I like best is I can navigate and search for content on a phone or tablet without tying up the television screen. I think that is a big benefit.  That use case alone makes it more enjoyable to use than Roku.I read rumors that Plex will soon be supported by chrome cast. If that is true, that would be a major win for me. I have plenty of content on my Plex Media Server that I would like to stream to the rooms.Downside of the device? None really, at least not as far as I can tell.
